content.title: Scheme to Provide Grant to the Institutions for Long Term Project in the Field of Art and Culture (Sarjansheel Goa)
content.department: Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa
content.beneficiary: Institutions and Individuals involved in long-term projects in the field of Art and Culture
content.details: The scheme provides financial support to the institutions/individuals involved in long-term projects in the field of Art & Culture. The objectives include creating a cultural environment in Goa, providing financial support, and preserving the cultural heritage of Goa.
benefits: A grant to the extent of 80% of the total expenditure involved, subject to a maximum ceiling of ₹ 5,00,000 per annum.
eligibility: For Institutions: Any institution registered under the Society’s Registration Act, 1860 or Indian Trust Act, involved in long-term projects in the field of Art and Culture.

For Individuals: Any individual from the Goan community, who has been a resident of Goa for 15 years or more, involved in a long-term project in the field of Art and Culture with at least 15 years of contribution.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants must visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, request a hard copy of the proforma, fill in the application form, and submit it along with the required documents.
documents_required: For Institutions: Constitution/By-laws/Rules and Regulations, Registration Certificate, Audited statement of accounts for the last 3 years, Detailed project report.
For Individuals: Residence Certificate of 15 years or more in Goa, Detailed report of contributions for the last 15 years, Detailed project report.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for disbursing the grant to eligible institutions or individuals?
faqs.answer: Once the Sub-Committee provides recommendations, the Director of Art & Culture obtains government approval, after which the grant amount is disbursed to eligible institutions/individuals in the form of a cheque.

faqs.question: Are there guidelines in place to ensure the proper implementation of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the government may frame guidelines from time to time to ensure the effective implementation of this scheme.

faqs.question: How is the selection of beneficiaries carried out under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The selection of beneficiaries involves the government constituting a Sub-Committee that reviews and evaluates applications.

faqs.question: What happens if there is a dispute or grievance related to the implementation of this scheme?
faqs.answer: In case of grievances arising from the implementation of this scheme, the Minister for Art and Culture is responsible for hearing and deciding such matters.
